results.title: The Plan
results.creator_credit: Bescher Films, Dianne Orr and C Larry Roberts
results.brief_description: Features Michele Meservy, Utah’s Young Mother of the Year for 1978. Follows this intelligent and committed Mormon Mother through the rigours of her day, taking care of her five young children and husband, and reflecting on her life, obligations and spiritual destiny.

results.title: The Plains of Heaven
results.brief_description: In this inversion of the buddy-film two technicians manning a tracking station on the High Plains pursue diametrically opposed ways of coping with the isolation. The ageing Cunningham seems to be rejuvenated by and obsessed with the landscape while the younger Barker withdraws into the station and its attendant technology. Return to Barker’s Melbourne becomes a descent into a fragmented, nightmare cityscape. The denial of cause and effect explanations for behaviour invites a metaphysical interpretation of this ambiguously down-side existential drama of disorientation and alienation not dissimilar to Werner Herzog’s visionary dramas although without the German director’s quirky black humour. Cast: Richard Moir, Reg Evans, Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: The Plague [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project, Richard McRoberts and Barry Washington
results.brief_description: A program which provides an analysis of the novel “The Plague” by Albert Camus, some comments on symbolism found in it and some stimulus for further discussion. Discusses the life and philosophy of Camus with reference to the novel; various subject levels of the novel; narrative structure and characters.

results.title: The Place at the coast (Captioned)
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1961, Ellie and her father travel to the seaside town of Kilkee for their annual holiday. For a time, the two enjoy their past routines - Ellie, a keen naturalist, observing and recording the native wildlife, her father fishing. However, a tourist development plan is proposed which will change their summer retreat, and Ellie soon learns that she is alone in her opposition to change. Cast includes John Hargreaves, Heather Mitchell, Tushka Bergen.

results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Film Productions, John Richardson and David Greig
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: The Pizzini Family
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: This is a story about an Italian-Australian family made unique by three generations of winemakers and master chefs. Meet Natalie, Alfred, Arnold, Katrina, Carla and matriarch Rosetta Pizzini, hear about the four brothers that immigrated to Australia and started farming tobacco, eventually diversifying to growing Italian variety grapes. The Pizzini’s make their own wine, run a cooking school and manage a boutique hotel in Whitfield, but still the most important part of their day is when they sit together and share a meal, a glass of wine and a laugh.

results.title: The Pitch
results.brief_description: Films aren’t always plotted from start to finish. In animated films, teams of artists often develop scenes and stories that are then performed to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film. This is the ‘pitch’ and it’s an integral part of storyboarding.

constellations_primary.name: The Pitch
constellations_primary.description: Explore fantastical worlds and underwater seascapes.

results.description:
Films aren’t always plotted from start to finish. In animated films, teams of artists often develop scenes and stories that are then performed to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film. This is the ‘pitch’ and it’s an integral part of storyboarding. Because of the close relationship between story, pacing and drawing, storyboard artists need to be performers, storytellers and visual artists.

Conrad Vernon was a storyboard artist on Shrek (2001) and co-director on Shrek 2 (2004), as well as the voice of the Gingerbread Man in the series. In this scene from Shrek, Lord Farquaad ruthlessly (and hilariously) interrogates Gingerbread Man to find the whereabouts of Duloc’s exiled fairytale creatures.

Tom McGrath was a storyboard artist, writer and co-director on the Madagascar trilogy, as well the voice of Skipper in the series. In this scene from Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008), the zoo animals take off in a rickety plane with high hopes of it returning them safely to New York City.
description_for_label:

Because of the close relationship between story, pacing and drawing, storyboard artists need to be performers, storytellers and visual artists.

Conrad Vernon was a storyboard artist on Shrek (2001) and co-director on Shrek 2 (2004), as well as the voice of the Gingerbread Man in the series. In this scene from Shrek, Lord Farquaad ruthlessly (and hilariously) interrogates Gingerbread Man to find the whereabouts of Duloc’s exiled fairytale creatures.

Tom McGrath was a storyboard artist, writer and co-director on the Madagascar trilogy, as well the voice of Skipper in the series. In this scene from Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008), the zoo animals take off in a rickety plane with high hopes of it returning them safely to New York City.

results.title: The Pitcairn people
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: A record of the life today of the people of Pitcairn Island, two square miles of volcanic rock in the Pacific, where the mutineers from the Bounty started a new life in 1790.

results.title: The Pirogue maker
results.creator_credit: Humble Oil and Refining Company and Arnold Eagle
results.brief_description: The shaping of a small boat known as a pirogue, from a cypress tree trunk; an intriguing record of a fast-dying art by descendents of the Acadians who left Nova Scotia in 1755. Flaherty’s films “Louisiana story” led to the tracing of one of the few remaining pirogue makers, Hebron Allemand whose work was recorded with Acadian folk songs giving local background.
